job.title: Front End Cloud Software Developer
job.description: Candidate Requirements Must be physically located in the United States Must be a US Citizen or legally eligible to work in the US without requiring sponsorship Must be fluent in written and verbal English Minimum of 3 years of SFCC (Commerce Cloud) experience Responsibilities - You will: Produce excellent code while collaborating with internal development resources at the client. Partner with other Red Vanners for QA, Project Management, and troubleshooting development issues. Participate in stand-up meetings, conference calls, track your time, and work through tickets assigned to you within a Jira instance. Lots of tickets. Work remotely with the distributed team at Red Van as well as client resources, being available during core business hours. Act with urgency and professionalism when interfacing with client resources. Don’t worry, our Project Managers step in to handle the primary communication and resolve conflicts with clients. Learn from some of the best on how to develop within the enterprise level e-commerce platform, Salesforce B2C Commerce Cloud. Skills and Experience needed for success: 3-5 years minimum of experience with developing software and technical implementations of customer projects. Experience building web applications, especially in the Node.js environment. Experience with object-oriented languages and concepts, including development work using .NET, Javascript or other similar languages Hands-on professional experience in designing, documenting and developing web-based and stand-alone software applications. Strong understanding of Front end and Back end web development. Some experience evaluating and implementing cloud-based solutions Excellent communication skills and a demonstrated ability to work independently. Possess analytical, problem-solving, teamwork and communication skills as well as creativity and attention to detail; familiarity with database management, development environment, program testing, and other related software. Appreciation for web standards and accessibility (e.g. WCAG Standards, screenreader support, semantic HTML). Excitement to play a critical and evolving role in driving technical initiatives to enhance end-user and developer experiences. Experienced working with designers to create and maintain style guides & CSS standards across different applications. Compensation: $90,000, - $120,000 annually Perks and Benefits: Work fully remote within the US Comprehensive benefits and health coverage Annual bonus Paid vacation, sick leave, and time off to volunteer Paid leave for new parents We invest in your future by contributing 3% of your salary to a 401(K), even if you don't Recurring stipend to upgrade your home office and equipment
